statement_text: Giving evidence to parliament's Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Committee, Griffiths said total turkey production for Christmas in the UK was usually about 8.5 to 9 million birds. Of these [total turkey production] just over one million had died or been culled. He said he did not know what the impact would be on prices.
